''Rolling Stone'' | rev7Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}} {{cite book |url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/sitbv3/reader?asin=0743201698&pageID=S0IL |title=The New Rolling Stone Album Guide |first1=Nathan |last1=Brackett |first2=Christian |last2=Hoard |edition=Revised 4th |year=2004 |publisher=Firefly |isbn=978-0743201698}} | noprose = yes }} '''''Chaos and Disorder''''' is the eighteenth [[studio album]] by [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] (his stage name at that time being the love symbol he created). It was his final album of new material for [[Warner Bros. Records]] and was therefore produced as a collection of leftovers only put on record to fulfill contractual obligations. ''Chaos and Disorder'' was one of Prince's least commercially successful releases and met mixed reviews upon release. Some reviewers commented that had it not been a Prince release, it would have been met with much wider approval.{{Citation needed|date=December 2009}} The album reached #26 in the US{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r237964|tab=charts-awards|label="''Chaos and Disorder'' > Charts & Awards > Billboard Albums" |accessdate={{date|2011-09-16}}}} and #14 in the UK,{{cite web |url=http://www.chartstats.com/albuminfo.php?id=11422 |title=Chaos and disorder |publisher=chartstats.com |accessdate={{date|2011-09-16}}}} and is now out of print. ==Track listing== # "Chaos and Disorder" â 4:19 # "I Like It There" â 3:15 # "[[Dinner with Delores]]" â 2:46 # "The Same December" â 3:24 # "Right the Wrong" â 4:39 # "Zannalee" â 2:43 # "I Rock, Therefore I Am" â 6:15 # "Into the Light" â 2:46 # "I Will" â 3:37 # "Dig U Better Dead" â 3:59 # "Had U" â 1:26 ==Singles and Hot 100 positions== * "[[Dinner with Delores]]" (#36 UK{{cite web |url=http://www.chartstats.com/release.php?release=24129 |title=Dinner With Delores |publisher=chartstats.com |accessdate={{date|2011-09-16}}}}) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Prince}} [[Category:1996 albums]] [[Category:Prince (musician) albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Prince (musician)]] [[Category:Warner Bros.
